text: Is the test environment of PKG in any way connected to the global state of the repel? If I develop my package the repl state might be quite dirty. Is it always enough to call `] test` to get valid test results?

elements.text: Is the test environment of PKG in any way connected to the global state of the repel? If I develop my package the repl state might be quite dirty. Is it always enough to call

text: Yes, but note that Pkg.test collect the package versions from the env you call Pkg.test from

elements.text: Yes, but note that Pkg.test collect the package versions from the env you call Pkg.test from

text: testing a package happens in a different environment to the global state of the REPL
